profileText: a Representative from Colorado; born in Dallas, Dallas County, Tex., June 7, 1964; graduated from Chester W. Nimitz High School, Irving, Tex., 1982; graduated from New Mexico State University, Alamogordo, N. Mex., 1986; United States Air Force, 1983-1987; financial advisor; business owner; Mayor of Parker, Colo., 1992-1996; Colo. state director, U.S. Small Business Administration, 2008-2014; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of Colorado in 2018; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of Colorado in 2022; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Kenneth Robert Buck (June 25, 2024-present).
